div.div: ῥέπω (ϝρ.): sink in the scale, used figuratively of the balances of fate, ῥέπε δ᾽ αἴσιμον ἦμαρ Ἀχαιῶν (meaning that their fate was sealed, an expression the converse in form, but the counterpart in sense, of our ‘kick the beam’), Il. 8.72, Il. 22.212. (Il.)
From A Homeric Dictionary (Georg Autenrieth, New York, Harper and Brothers, 1891)
